title: The S&P Is Likely Moving Higher In This Week
text: The S&P is likely to rise in the coming week.

title: Here's What Wall Street Will Focus on Next Week as Fed Rate Panel Meets
text: The projection for the federal-funds rate is key, after the recent rise in bond yields.

title: Higher Rates Won't Kill the Stock Market. What to Do Now.
text: The market could well rise higher still. The stocks leading it, however, might be a little different than the ones that led it to records in 2020.

title: Take Five: Week of the central banks
text: After a stunning selloff in U.S. Treasuries took benchmark 10-year yields above 1.6%, the highest in a year, the March 16-17 Federal Reserve meeting will be watched closely for hints policymakers are concerned about yields, asset bubbles and inflation.

title: We're hitting a SPAC peak, says Vanity Fair's William Cohan
text: William Cohan, Vanity Fair contributor and angel investor Jason Calacanis debate whether SPACs have gotten out of hand as a way of raising money and what should be done about it.

title: As Rare as the Loch Ness Monster, Equities at a 10 P/E
text: By Jeff Weniger, CFA, Head of Equity Strategy “Nessie.” That's the nickname for the lake-living, reclusive beast that has lured spellbound tourists to a fabled Scottish lake—Loch Ness—for decades.

title: The S&P 500 and Covid-19: What Stocks Rose the Most Since Last Year's Lows?
text: March 11 marked the one-year anniversary of the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declaring Covid-19 a pandemic. The world has been through a heartbreaking year, and even though recovery is on the horizon with vaccine rollouts, the virus is still spreading and governments are attempting a difficult balancing act between people's safety and their ability to make a living.

title: Wall Street Week Ahead: Energy shares look for next spark as investors eye recovering economy
text: Investors betting on U.S. energy shares have enjoyed a blistering rally, as the sector leads a move into value and economically sensitive stocks that has gripped the equity market. How much further that run continues could hinge on the success of the economic recovery, supply dynamics in oil markets and whether companies can stay disciplined on spending.

title: The tech-heavy Nasdaq has underperformed the Dow for four straight weeks — a first since 2016
text: The Nasdaq bounced back after a three-week slump, but it still fell short of the Dow, which climbed 4.1% this week and is trading a record.

title: The Fed could be a catalyst for bonds, and that could drive growth stocks in week ahead
text: Bonds could be volatile in the week ahead. If yields go higher, that could make it difficult for big tech and other growth stocks to gain traction.

title: Alli McCartney says rates will move up, but time will tell whether it means growth or inflation
text: Alli McCartney, UBS Private Wealth Management managing director, says rates will continue to move up. She says that based on the latest consumer price index and Treasury issuance, there will be bullish uptrends in the markets.

title: Market Recap: Friday, March 12: Tech stocks slide as Treasury yields climb
text: Stocks traded mixed on Friday as technology stocks came under renewed pressure. Treasury yields resumed their march higher.

title: Vanguard Commentary: Topping Barron's Active Fund Charts Once Again
text: The year 2020 joins 1929, 1987, 2000, and 2008 as periods that truly tested the mettle of active fund managers. But 2020 was unique in that the financial markets saw both lows and highs, with a steep drop in March followed by a remarkably rapid recovery.

title: These are Fed Chair Jerome Powell's top challenges
text: CNBC's Steve Liesman reports on the tough road ahead for the Federal Reserve and chairman Jerome Powell. title: The Dow Rose 293 Points. Higher Rates Lifted Value Stocks and Crushed Tech.
text: The Dow and the S&P 500 set records, while tech stocks such as Zoom Video were hammered. Interest rates spiked to their highest in more than a year.

title: MacroView: Yellen's 'Go Big' MMT Plan May Disappoint
text: Yellen's "Go Big" MMT plan was fulfilled this week as the Government passed the mammoth $1.9 trillion "American Rescue Plan Act of 2021."

title: Dow hits record highs as Treasury yields climb
text: Yahoo Finance's Kristin Myers spoke to RiverFront Investment Group's Rebecca Felton about the rise in Treasury yields and what it means for investors.

title: Long-Term Look At The CPI
text: The Consumer Price Index for Urban Consumers (CPI-U) released Wednesday puts the year-over-year inflation rate at 1.68%.

title: Wall Street ends mixed session marked by stimulus hopes and concerns about rising bond yields
text: 4:15pm: US equities close mixed session US stocks closed a mixed session, marked by stimulus hopes and concerns about rising interest rates.    The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped to an all-time high as rising reopening optimism continued to encourage the rotation into cyclical stocks.

title: Dow closes at record high, tech falters as traders mull the impact of Biden's stimulus
text: The Dow Jones industrial average closed at a record high on Friday while tech stocks fell as a rise in interest rates fueled a continued rotation into cyclical stocks poised to benefit from a reopened economy.  The yield on the 10-year US Treasury note spiked to 1.64% on Friday, representing a new cycle high since the COVID-19 pandemic began.

title: Dow, S&P 500 clinch back-to-back all-time highs amd tech stocks slip to end the week as Treasury yields above 1.62%
text: The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average booked record closes for a second day in a row, while the Nasdaq Composite saw some selling as a rise in yields for government debt continue to push investors out of highflying, growthy stocks and into those that are expected to perform better during a vaccine-induced rebound from the COVID-19 pandemic. The Dow closed up about 290 points on Friday, or 0.9%, to post a record finish at around 32,777, while the S&P 500 index closed at its own all-time high at 3,934, up 0.1%.

title: Big U.S. Stocks' Q4'20 Fundamentals
text: Big US stocks' recently-reported Q4'20 results revealed that stock markets remain dangerously overvalued deep into bubble territory. All the revenues, earnings, and operating-cash-flow-generation growth is still concentrated in mega-cap techs.

title: Investing in REITs in 2021: Why the real estate uptick may be signaling a REIT rebound
text: Yahoo Finance's Myles Udland spoke to AEW Captial Management's Gina Szymanski about investing in REITs.

title: Stocks to watch that may benefit from the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan
text: Chris Versace, Tematica Research Chief Investment Officer, joins Yahoo Finance's Alexis Christoforous to discuss volatility in the tech sector, rise in consumer sentiment, and stocks to watch.

title: Stocks Could Rally 10% Really Soon. Here's Why.
text: The S&P 500 cleared a critical technical level, analyst Tom Lee says.

title: Federal Reserve Watch: Federal Reserve Remains Very Easy
text: Many investors are watching the Federal Reserve these days to see just how long Fed officials will continue to underwrite the $1.9 trillion Biden tax plan and the stock market.

title: Don Fishback on Options Valuation and Probability [PODCAST]
text: On the latest Market Mashup, Patrick is back with author, analyst, and options trader extraordinaire Don Fishback to discuss his work on options valuation and probability over the years.

title: Tax provisions under the American Rescue Plan
text: AmericanRescuePlan Yahoo Finance's Zack Guzman spoke with CBIZ MHM's National Tax Office Managing Director Bill Smith about taxes and the American Rescue Plan.

title: Benchmarks Bounce Back on Additional Covid-19 Relief
text: Stocks staged an impressive comeback this week, as investors celebrated the Covid-19 stimulus and retreating bond yields.

title: Need to expect volatility in tech, says chief strategist
text: Alicia Levine, BNY Mellon Investment Management chief strategist, and Ron Insana, CNBC senior analyst and commentator and senior advisor to Schroeder's North America, join 'Power Lunch' to discuss the state of the market and the opportunities they see.

title: What's Moving The Market Friday?
text: Top News The U.S. Producer Price Index fell from 1.3% in January to 0.5% in February.

title: Billionaire Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit has reportedly hired bankers to go pubic via SPAC merger
text: Billionaire Richard Branson has reportedly hired bankers to take his aerospace company Virgin Orbit public through a special purpose acquisition company merger, aiming for a $3 billion valuation, The Wall Street Journal reported Friday. This move is consistent with the billionaire's strategy of taking his companies public via blank-check listings amid the explosion of SPACs in recent years. SPACs are essentially shell companies seeking to merge with private companies with the intention of taking them public.

title: The Tell: ‘No peace' for markets until 10-year Treasury yield hits 2%, strategist says
text: A bond market selloff is calling the tune across financial markets. Equilibrium is unlikely to return until the yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note hits 2%, a well-known macro strategist argued Friday.

title: Still in early stages of a bull market: Portfolio manager
text: CNBC's Jon Fortt discusses markets and what investors should be watching with Brian Belski of BMO Capital Markets and Nancy Prial of Essex Investment Management. title: Making a Profit from Stock Dips
text: The secret is to buy stocks that have been burned, but still have the potential to soar. Learn how to find them.

title: Market Underestimates Power of Economic Reopening: Golub
text: Mar.12 -- Jonathan Golub, chief U.S. equity strategist at Credit Suisse, says value stocks will have faster earnings growth then growth stocks this year. He's on "Bloomberg The Open.

title: Rates Are Heading Even Higher And That's Bad News For Stocks
text: The reflation trade has been driven higher by rising inflation expectations. However, that's due to the 10-year note rising faster than the 10-year TIP.

title: Earnings expectations need to offset fears of rising rates, says investor
text: CNBC's Scott Wapner talks with the "Halftime Report" team to break down how they're investing right now.

title: Tom Lee: There's a lot of reasons to be more optimistic
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team is joined by Tom Lee of Fundstrat Global Advisors about his expectations for the markets and economy.

title: Inflation Watch: Beware The Ides Of March
text: President Biden has now had his $1.9 trillion stimulus package passed into law, and it will not be the last in the current fiscal year. Today's interventionism is all-embracing, with governments assuming that by taking total control through regulation, inflationary financing and suppression of interest rates the modern economic system will never fail.

title: History shows why it doesn't pay to bet against US stocks
text: Looking at the stock market, you'd never know that a year ago this week was the Coronavirus Crash.

title: US benchmarks mixed but Dow Jones surges as bond yields again hit tech sector
text: 12.20pm: US stocks mixed US stocks were mixed at lunch but the Dow Jones Industrial Average powered to a new high. On Wall Street, the Dow was up over 167 points at 32,652, while the Nasdaq plunged 129 points to 13,267 as the yield on the 10-year Treasury bond rose.

title: What Do Climbing Yields Mean for Equity Valuations?
text: Yields on the benchmark 10-year Treasury have experienced a rapid rise since the start of the year. Though low by historical standards, it's been enough to cause some pain in many sectors of the market.

title: Don't Fall For The Bull Trap
text: Investors should be cautious not to buy the dip that keeps on dipping. The major indices remain well off their highs, and strong bounces on good market breadth are a symptom of higher volatility, not a signal of strength.

title: Vaccines and stimulus boost US consumer sentiment
text: American consumers are growing more confident as the light at the end of the pandemic tunnel becomes brighter.

title: The Fed: Fed to stay dovish next week as Powell channels his inner- Gary Cooper calm
text: Fed Chairman Jerome Powell will reaffirm his commitment to the central bank's current dovish monetary stance, former central bank economists said.

title: JOLTS Revisions: Much Better Reopening, But Why Didn't It Last?
text: According to newly revised BLS benchmarks, the labor market might have been a little bit worse than previously thought during the worst of last year's contraction. The JOLTS labor series annual revisions took about 300,000 off the estimated level of Job Openings (JO), one way to figure demand for labor, in each March and April 2020.

title: Tepid Economic Recovery: The iM-Weekly Unemployment Monitor: Update 3/11/2021
text: A truer picture of the employment situation is extracted from the Unemployment Insurance Weekly Claims (UIWC) report. Persons receiving some form of unemployment benefit account for 12.6% of the labor force.

title: Stock Market At Record Levels On Stimulus Hopes
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500, and Russell 2000 are trading at record levels as investors bid up stocks on hopes the recent stimulus bill will boost the economy. In today's video, we will discuss current investing themes, market leaders, and sector rotation.
